conclusion: To analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D change as the light source moves to the right, we need to consider shadow position and size.
As the light source moves to the right, the shadows will shift to the left.
The shadows may become larger if the light source is moving closer to the objects, assuming it's coming from a higher angle.
If the light source remains at a constant height but moves to the right, the shadows will likely stretch further to the left but may not significantly change in size.
Shadow A is cast by the cake.
As the light source moves to the right, shadow A will shift to the left and potentially elongate.
Shadow B is cast by the card.
As the light source moves to the right, shadow B will shift to the left and may become longer.
Shadow C is cast by the roll of paper.
As the light source moves to the right, shadow C will shift to the left and potentially elongate.
Shadow D is cast by the soccer ball.
As the light source moves to the right, shadow D will shift to the left and might elongate, depending on the vertical distance between the light source and the objects.
Initially, the light source is above the objects, casting shadows directly below.
When the light source moves to the right, shadows shift to the left.
When the light source moves closer, shadows may elongate; otherwise, they stretch further due to the angle.
Shadow A moves left and possibly elongates.
Shadow B moves left and possibly elongates.
Shadow C moves left and possibly elongates.
Shadow D moves left and possibly elongates.
As the light source moves to the right, all shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift to the left and may elongate, depending on the height and proximity of the light source.
